feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Identity Management
feed.subtitle: SAP Identity Management Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: No Identity Provisioning on IAS
entry.content:
I am using an existing Internal IAS that I did not set up by request and it has no Identity Provisioning.
The"Manage Identity Provisioning" role is missing is not available or listed for Admins in the IAS Admin console.

Does it need to be bundled with IAS when initially requested?
From my understanding it is now auto included with IAS.

This is no help 3253894 - Identity Authentication Service "Manage Identity Provisioning" role is missing 
I am on a CF BTP Sub account and want to better understand with the demise of SAML2 on sub accounts for Trust to IAS.

entry.title: Inter-tenant Communication and API Key Verification in IAS
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community

I am working on a project where we need to ensure secure inter-tenant communication within SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS). Specifically, we need to verify API keys for requests coming from one tenant to another.

Background: Our requirement involves SupportIAS forwarding token requests to CustomerIAS. To ensure the security and validity of this process, we have outlined the following steps:

1. Authenticate Request Source: Verify that the request is coming from the trusted SupportIAS.

2. Verify Permissions: Ensure the Support Engineer has the necessary permissions to impersonate the selected user.

3. Data Integrity Check: Validate the integrity of the user details and selected user ID.

Key Questions:

1. Inter-tenant Communication: Does IAS support such inter-tenant communication out of the box?

2. API Key Verification: What mechanisms are available within IAS to verify API keys for internal communications?

3. Documentation: Is there any official documentation or best practices guide that covers these topics?

Request for Guidance: I would greatly appreciate any insights, best practices, or pointers to relevant documentation that could help us validate and implement this approach effectively.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

Best regards,

[Bhaskar]

entry.title: [PLT-86245] - 1H 2025 Release - Monitoring Tool for IAS - LMS-IAS Integration support capabilities
entry.content:
Hello SAP,

I have the following question on the Enhancements to Monitoring Tool for Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning [PLT-86245] feature delivered with the 1H 2025 release for the Partner Q&A session: 
- which capabilities does the monitoring tool provide for the LMS-IAS integration upgrade, esp. in the area of trouble shooting?

Kind regards

Roman

entry.title: How to Add a Custom Button on IAS Login Page Redirecting to a Public URL
entry.content:
Hello,

We have an application that uses SAP IAS (Identity Authentication Service) for login. I need to add a custom button on the IAS login page that redirects users to a public URL. This button should work similarly to the "Not registered? Sign up here" link but should direct users to a different location.

I found this SAP Help blog: Configure User Access to Application (https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/configure-user-access-to-application?q=self+registration), but it focuses on self-registration within IAS. Instead, I need the button to redirect users to an external public URL.

How can I achieve this using IAS customization options? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you!

entry.title: Update primary & secondary email for an user in SuccessFactors EC concurrently using OData API
entry.content:
Hi IDM Gurus,

For an user in SF moved from Onboarding module to EC, their personal email is carried forward and marked as primary email(for example "xxx@xxx.com" in PerEmail entity set as 'isPrimary=true'). Now when IDM generates business email(or example "yyy@yyy.com" ) and tries to set using OData API, I'm getting error "Only one email address can be set as primary"

I understand that, only one email can be set as primary and IDM is able to set business email as secondary. However in such case how do we set business email as primary and personal email as secondary in one request using OData?

I find SAP Note https://me.sap.com/notes/2749494/E to bundle both request in one OData payload but how do we bundle it in SAP IDM?

Here is IDM request -

entry.title: IAS - SAC Role Maping
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have the following scenario: Azure as the IdP, IAS as a proxy, and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

My want is to implement IAS in a way that Azure AD groups are mapped to SAC teams, and then assign the corresponding SAC roles via SAML mapping.
For example: Azure group sac_adm → SAC team sac_adm → SAML mapping assigns the sac_adm role.

However, I have a few SAC teams where users within the same team need to have different roles in SAC.
How can this be achieved — having one team, but users within that team with different SAC roles?

 

Many Thanks

Best regards

entry.title: Azure /IAS User filtering
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m using Azure as IdP and IAS as a proxy.
In Azure, I have created groups which are then provisioned to cloud applications via IAS. In IPS I have set up a source system for Azure.

My requirement is to provision only specific groups and their users to IAS – for example, all groups whose names start with "SAP_" – without having to constantly modify the JSON transformation code.

To achieve this, I have configured the following parameters in the source system:

aad.group.filter = startsWith(displayName,'SAP_')

aad.user.filter.group.filter.combine = true

However, it seems that with these settings, all users in Azure are still being queried, which – as far as I understand – can lead to performance issues, especially in large environments.

My questions:

Is there a way to use the aad.user.filter parameter to ensure that only users who belong to the filtered groups (e.g., those with the prefix SAP_) are provisioned, without having to hardcode group names or regularly change the transformation code?

Is it possible to implement something like this:

aad.user.filter = users who belong to the groups defined in aad.group.filter

What is the recommended approach to efficiently and dynamically filter only the required groups and their members?

Thank you in advance for your support

 

Many Thanks

entry.title: Update Number Range Interval->NR Status in SAP HCM from SAP IDM
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

Our Company requirement is that SAP IDM should update the NR Status column for the Number Range Interval in SAP HCM. Appreciate if you could help to confirm whether it can be done or not as we couldn't find any relevant information in the standard SAP IDM documentation.

In case, it can be done, please share the relevant document/URL which provide the details reg this.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP IAS Federated Access AWS Cognito
entry.content:
Hello SAP-Community,

In a recent project for a client, we had a feature request that consisted of making a Fiori application available in SAP BTP Workzone, so far so good. Currently, this client has a mobile application developed by a third party that uses AWS Cognito as an identity provider (IdP) and our need is to provide access to this Fiori application without a request new login.

My question would be whether it is possible to establish a trust relationship between SAP IAS and AWS Cognito so that a new login operation is not required? If so, is there any documentation or a step-by-step guide to help us?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Reverse Proxy is being disabled
entry.content:
Hello team,

I have a client that is using Reverse Proxy for LMS tenant and I'd like to know what will be the impact of the deprecation once it happens.

entry.title: IPS - delete user
entry.content:
Hi Experts,
I’m using IPS to provision users from IAS to SAP Enable Now.
When I remove a user from the IAS group, they are not deleted from Enable Now after the IPS job runs.

Is there a way to automatically delete users in Enable Now via IPS?

Many Thanks

 

Best regards

entry.title: User deactivate via IPS
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We provision users from Azure -> IAS -> Enable Now using IPS.

If a user for example:  test1) is removed/deleted from the group in Azure/ IAS, and an IPS Job runs afterward, the user (test1) is not deleted in Enable Now; only their roles are removed. However, the user remains "Active" in Enable Now.

Can the user in Enable Now be deactivated (i.e., the "Active" checkbox removed) through the IPS Job if the user is deleted/removed from the Azure/IAS group?

Or is there a way to automatically deactivate the user in Enable Now instead of directly deleting them?

 Does anyone have an idea ?

Many Thanks

Best Regards

entry.title: SAP IDM: check field value before submit a form
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a form in IDM for the user management of an SAP system, in this form we have the manager of the user and the value of approval of the user.

I would like to check during the backup in order to verify that the approval value is lower than that of its manager.

I have seen the Extension Framework but it seems to me quite complex to set up.

Do you have a solution to help me?

Regards,

Michael RIANT

entry.title: BTP Trial IAS Provisioning Issue
entry.content: “My BTP trial global account ID is 58dc44e9trial in us10. Identity Authentication token URL exists, but the admin UI and SAML metadata both return errors (Uh oh, 404). I'm unable to establish trust to subscribe to SAP Build Work Zone. Please advise.”

entry.title: Modifying user license from IPS
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am provisioning users from IPS to AS ABAP and it works great. Now I have the requirement to add user license type based on groups in local identity.

Before the change everyting works as expected but after adding the payload bellow I am getting the error:

IDENTITY_MODIFY function returned response number 279 and errors: Enter a user name. ,

The payload added to the call from IPS to AS ABAP.

{"UCLASS":[{"LIC_TYPE":"HB"}],"UCLASSX":{"UCLASS":"X","UCLASSSYS":"R"}

I found this post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/provisioning-license-type-to-abap-target-systems/qaq-p/6708235 but can't find the response mentioned in the answer above.

entry.title: IAS/IPS – Efficient Group Setup?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are using SAP IAS/IPS with Azure as Idp. We have already connected several SAP Cloud Apps to IAS, and more apps will be added.

Access to these apps is controlled by groups in Azure. For example, depending on a user’s role in SAC or Enable Now, different groups are created in Azure.

In SAC, we already have at least 10 groups, and in Enable Now even more. As more SAP Cloud Apps are connected, the number of Azure groups increases quickly.

My question is:
Is there a better or easier way to manage roles and access without creating so many groups in Azure?

How do you manage this in your environment to keep it organized and scalable?

Thanks for your help

Best regards

entry.title: Login Name for Manual IAS Users
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are provisioning users from Azure AD → SAP IAS → SAP Enable Now using IPS.


There are two types of users in our setup:

Internal users from Azure AD:
We map the employeeId from Azure to the Login Name field in IAS, which is then used as the userName in SAP Enable Now employeeid(Azure)->LoginName(IAS)->User Name(Enable Now)

External users created manually in IAS:
These users do not have a Login Name and the userName in Enable Now is a required field and provisioning fails.

Is there a way to automatically populate the Login Name field in IAS when creating users manually?
Have you implemented a similar solution or do you have any ideas or best practices for this scenario?

Thanks in advance for your help

Best regards

entry.title: how to provision assignments with validity date from SAP IPS to AS ABAP system
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Has anyone been able to provision users to AS ABAP SAP System from IPS where the AS ABAP system is configured as an target or else as proxy system. what should be maintained in the transformation so that the connector can provision? 

I am guessing this is the Function Module which we will be using ips connector uses to provision user assignments BAPI_USER_ACTGROUPS_ASSIGN.

I see this function module accepts validity dates for role assignments? but how to pass this in the write transformation logic?

currently in write transformation of proxy system below is the logic. As per my understanding for each role the user would be assigned? then how can be pass the validity dates for each role assignment? does the IPS support that?

{
        "sourcePath": "$.members[*].value",
        "preserveArrayWithSingleElement": true,
        "targetPath": "$.USERLIST[?(@.USERNAME)]",
        "optional": true,
        "functions": [
          {
            "type": "decode",
            "algorithm": "base32",
            "skipPadding": true
          },
          {
            "type": "toString",
            "applyOnElements": true
          }
        ]
      }

 



/Deva

entry.content:
Hi

my question:  i had in IDM,  updated the ID from a task and reactivated it. (MX_DISABLED=0) everything is ok in the DB and in all back-end the id is recativated but in the IDM UI its still check  

I search but id didnt  find where  i can update/refresh  the java side IDM ui  and how ?

entry.title: Error Provisioning roles from IdM to HANA repositories - The provided input is not valid design time
entry.content:
Hello All,

I have been trying to assign few roles to users from IdM to HANA repositories but received error stating that The provided input is not valid design time role.  I can assign the role manually in HANA system.

Could you please check and help me out.

 

Thank you!!
